wikipedia_page.main: Henry Welfare (20 August 1888 – 1 September 1966)  was an English footballer and teacher who lived in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

response: Between June and August 1931 he and several players from Botafogo FC such as Nilo and Carvalho Leite re-inforced CR Vasco da Gama, also from Rio, on a trip to Europe – the only second trip to Europe by a Brazilian club since the one of CA Paulistano in 1925. In twelve matches in Portugal and Spain – among others against FC Barcelona, FC Porto, and S.L. Benfica and Sporting CP in Lisbon – the team of Vasco, coached by Harry Welfare, won eight times.Jorge Costa: Excursão do Vasco da Gama a Europa em 1931, Arquivo de Súmulas, 24 October 2010
